page.title: 06LYNCROFT FARM,P. BROOK.
page.content: Lyncroft is a chicken farm in Perrott's Brook owned by Mr and Mrs Thomas. The farm covers 22 acres and is 24 yrs old. The site was formerly a quarry, then a cattle farm before becoming a chicken farm. A Dyke which surrounded the town of an ancient Roman tribe is on their land. Mrs Thomas doesn't breed chickens she grows them. They are bought from Ross Hatcheries at 1 day old for Â£2 each. They are fed on chick meal or a pullet grower. The 2 sheds are heated by gas and each holds 9000 chicks. At 18 weeks they are sent to another farm to lay eggs. Mr Thomas is an R.A.F. officer. They hope to expand the farm in the future.
